author: protolambda
content: For eth2 client devs: I think we should sort out the remaining small differences how beacon configs are formatted. I've built a tool to essentially "lint" a config. Details here: https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/issues/2055

author: protolambda
content: Also, I'm nearing completion of a new prototype of a hive (eth1 testing)-like test runner, but for eth2 tests. Builds containers, keystores, states, etc. all to then run network/integration tests on. Standardization like reading the exact same custom config would be very helpful.

author: wemeetagain
content: Is the idea to standardize on using the exact fields and types as in the config thats in the spec? https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/blob/dev/configs/mainnet/phase0.yaml

author: protolambda
content: Yea, the linter should pass without errors on the spec config

author: protolambda
content: And then there's this file: https://github.com/protolambda/eth2-config-tester/blob/master/config_spec.yaml which would explicitly state what formatting type each config var is, without spreading it across documents or making the python->yaml tranlation unclear
